Comments_List: I learned about psychopathy and the various methods of determining likely psychopaths. I learned several important developmental signs and reasoning behind certain abnormal traits in adulthood. I have a much better understanding of psychopathy as a whole thanks to this class.
I learned about the different forms of psychopathy and the criminal mind. We studied criminal behavior in men, women, minorities, and children.

Strengths- Interesting material and subject matter. Well taught with clear descriptors.

Weaknesses- There is a lot of information to go over. While not necessarily a weakness, it can make the class rather difficult at times.
The exams were very tricky and did not represent course.
I would absolutely recommend this course to another student if they were interested in the subject matter. It is interesting and engaging to learn about psychopathy.
I would absolutely recommend this to another student. Professor Baskin-Sommers is an incredible professor and makes it very engaging despite being an online class.

Absolutely. Professor Baskin-Sommers makes it clear beyond any professor in my experience thus far at Yale that she is there to help you learn, not just memorize facts. She will answer any question, even if you feel like you should know it by then, or if it has been asked before. There are no dumb questions, and her non-judgemental teaching style facilitates better absorption of the engaging yet complex materials.
Yes. Extremely interesting and more relevant than it would appear.
